buildup.text: The Lenape likely saw the deal as a shared-use agreement. The Dutch saw it as a permanent purchase.

discovery.text: The two cultures had completely different concepts of land ownership. Neither understood the other.

climax.text: The 'deal of the century' was really a catastrophic miscommunication between two worlds.
